fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37903].
  {panel}

First of all: the macro doesn't behave as expected. It's documentation says: "List the related labels for a given set of labels, or for the current page"

I understand related labels as following:
The relation between labels exist since they are attached on the same page describing either a topic (e.g. quality, improvement, software_confluence, ...) or a type (issue, meeting-note, abbreviation, security-bulletin, ...) There is no hierarchie so that's the only relation implicitly given. If I enter one or multiple labels into the macro parameter then I expect to see all labels that are attached to all pages carrying this one/these multiple stated label.
The current output is designed with a different understanding so it actually works correct to your concept. BUT it has operational weaknesses!
How it works now:
SELECT all labels FROM all pages WHERE pages have ('label1' OR 'label2' OR ...)
How it should work:
SELECT all labels FROM all pages WHERE pages have ('label1' AND 'label2' AND ...)

This has to be understood:
* With 'OR' one gets all occurances of labels. If one enters more labels the list increases. This functionality therefore gets less useful the more content develops. That's why I suppose this macro to be rarely used (check it in your cloud and state the result, I'm highly interested): It deliveres too much lables increasingly related to the amount of content.
* With 'AND' the number of labels decreases with every added label. Principle: reduce to the max. with potential for fuzzy topic-based search.

How to improve:
# output related labels of pages containing all stated labels using 'AND' in the select statement. One can decrease the amount of labels using more labels in the parameter and then reduce this amount again with another label and so on.
# Allow choice of outputting 'list' or 'heatmap'. The heatmap indicates with it's size another information useful for searching.
# Allow choice of space (empty=all spaces, @self=current space, one or more spaces). That enables space navigation or topic-oriented navigation within a wikipage itself.
# if one clicks on one of these labels then without page reload the new label cloud is delivered and the selected label is shown in a separat list of 'selected labels' as well as the number of (visible) content items that contain all selected labels. If the user clicks on the number of content items then these are displayed for him to choose (which then actually can be connected with a page reload).

Recommendation: This macro should be used in the space navigation as an option to the page tree and on the site-search (if you adapt these suggestions one can use it also as a better topic navigation). When you click a label the label heatmap reloads and the labels shown are dependent on the label(s) clicked before. If one has the interesting labels then he receives the result pages. We can have a conference to talk about that idea in detail.

With this you'll lift label usage. I am sure! And this will work better with increasing page count within a space since the hierarchies weaknesses grow with the size of a space! Prepare for the future.
fields.summary: macro related-labels can be used as a navigation element but needs adaptions
RADIUS Client

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37891].
  {panel}

When a page with attachment is deleted the attachments are no longer listed in the "List Attachments" page.
This is inconvenient because the same attachment might be linked from multiple pages and leaving it attached to a deleted page is risky (if the page is purged, the attachment will be lost breaking several links).
There is also no warning or information when deleting a page that attachments are present (as for example for the info on pages linking to the page being deleted...) with the hint to first move them to another page if needed.
Today it is still possible to recover these attachments but it is cumbersome because a user has to restore the page, move the attachment and then delete the page again.
fields.summary: List attachements linked to deleted pages

Please compare the quality of the same thumbnails in Confluence and Basecamp.
Confluence cannot compete. In Basecamp I can read even some texts on thumbnails, no need to open each image.

for such cool collaborative tool as Confluence you must improve the rendering algorithm!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37858].
  {panel}

We created Confluence pages and added LaTex scripts to the page.  The page display the proper symbols, but have experienced the following problems:

1. All LaTex references, i.e. symbols, are removed when the page is exported to PDF or MS Word.  The remaining text (non-LaTex) exports just fine.

This happens with both inline and block LaTex macro.

2. Printing the Confluence page intermittently removes all LaTex symbols --- very few times it includes the symbols, but most times it also removes the LaTex symbols.
fields.summary: LaTex displays properly on webpage, but cannot be exported to PDF, MS Word, or Printed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37857].
  {panel}

In older versions of Confluence, you could clearly distinguish between normal text and Info or Warning macro.

In newer versions the difference is nearly invisible. Something like th{color:#707070}i{color}s (did you notice that the i is in another color?).
I really have to turn my head to some queer angle to see the diff. Too bad !!!!
This is also true for the compare page (compare historic versions of a page).

Probably a visible border would do much (a slightly darker border very much improves the contrast perception, even if the fill colour stays the same).
fields.summary: Info / Warning hardly visible; also compare option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37856].
  {panel}

*It would be a very huge (usability) improvement*, if Space Admins would be listed on the Page Not Found and Not Permitted Pages if a user has no access to a certain page!

Currently, if a user has no access to a page (s)he does not know what to do next:
# Why is there no access or is there really no page with that name?
# Who can be contacted to grant permissions?

Since we have 145.000 users it is very annoying to get plenty of permission requests, find Space Admins and forward the users to their Space Admins.

*To improve this simple permission request process*, we wish to have at least all Space Admins listed on the mentioned error pages with mailto links.

*A very nice feature* would be an implementation similar to the Page Restrictions process. Space Admins will get informed via mail&notification and can grant permissions to users who requested this!
fields.summary: Listing Space Admins on Page Not Found and Not Permitted Pages
Add page functionality restricted by page not space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37853].
  {panel}

To reproduce, you need a page holding a rather wide table.
The table will be shown with a scrollbar at the bottom of the table.
Sometimes (rather frequent but not always) there is now a 2nd scrollbar at the very bottom of the browser window (which is actually a different frame).
See screenshot.
The bottom scrollbar scrolls in parallel to the table scrollbar, so if you pull one of these scrollbars, the other one moves at the same time.

If there are more than one wide table in the page, the excess bottom scrollbar is a replication of the first table in the page.

Issue seems to happen in the Documentation Theme only, and only if the sidebar is turned on. When I adjust the width of the browser, the excess scrollbar usually disappears.

Issue found in version 5.8.4. 
(Your "Affects Version/s) does not have this version yet selectable.)

I have not tested this behavior in other browsers than Firefox.
fields.summary: Table Scrollbar (for wide tables) repeat at the bottom of the (FF) browser
Option to disable notifications to watchers when posting inline comments
Popular tab shows people who have long left the company

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37846].
  {panel}

This is an issue you guys know about, but apparently you don't respect your customers enough to resolve it.

The original ticket is "CONF-21844", which you've marked as "resolved" despite refusing to fix it.

To be clear- people who migrate from one machine to another have their backups start silently failing due to this bug. In fact, the backup job reports as having run, so it looks like things are working. People who think backups are working will be horribly surprised when they try to restore.

This should not be a difficult solution. If the "custom backup path" is disabled then use the default path instead of the custom one.
fields.summary: Backups are broken after migrations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37843].
  {panel}

Hi, 

When I copy a table from Excel into Confluence, sometimes it draws out the borders, but sometimes it doesn't. When it doesn't there isn't a way for me to make sure the borders are drawn out. 

Is there a workaround for this? Or do i have to manually create the table structure first in Confluence Edit mode and then copy the data from Excel? 

We're on version 4.3.5
fields.summary: When i copy tables from excel into confluence edit page it doesn't copy correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37835].
  {panel}

When adding a link in a page it is not possible to link to an anchor directly.
I would like to be able to get suggestions also for anchors.
These could be triggered, for example, by the typing of the # char.
Example, user types [# and the link suggestions shows all anchors or user types [pageX# and link suggestions shows all anchors in that page.
Same approach in the Insert link macro, in the Advanced sections.
fields.summary: Extend link search / suggestion to anchors

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37819].

Hi,

In my previous organization, we had a calendar macro in Confluence Wiki which can be inserted into a project page and team members can create their vacation events using the same. 

This helped us reduce manual vacation management and have a centralized place to manage project timelines better. 

I don't find it in this rsa wiki. Is there a way to get the calendar macro ?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37807].
  {panel}

Working with Blueprints As described in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Creating+a+Template

h3.Edit a Default Existing Global Template such as *Default Personal Space Content* (Works on New Templates)
# Choose the cog icon , then choose General Configuration under Confluence Administration
# Choose Global Templates and Blueprints in the left-hand panel
# Edit A pre-existing Template
# insert a variable into a template:
# Choose Template > New Variable from the editor toolbar (or choose an existing variable to add it to the page)
# Enter a name for the variable
# Press Enter (by default this will create a single-line text input field)
# Save

h1.Expected Behavior:
Template will contain the Variable

h1.Actual Behavior
All other changes will be visible, but the variables will not be displayed
fields.summary: "insert a variable into a template" on System Global Template Fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37806].
  {panel}

Hi,

We have experienced strange behavior in Confluence when moving pages from one space to another. We moved 6 pages (a parent page and 5 children) from one space to another space, Then the source space was archived These actions were performed successfully. The problem is that other 6 pages (presumably in the source space, have disappeared). They cannot be found in the trash or anywhere else in Confluence. We don't really know how this happened and we do not know how a number of pages can disappear from Confluence without leaving any trace. We suspect this had to do with moving pages from one space to another, but we are not really sure.

The pages contained quite a lot of content and attachments (images).

We are using Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Pages in target space disappear when moving pages from a source space
Documentation is not loading properly

To specify how many entries will show in Properties Report

Develop plugins comparability check for Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37785]. {panel} h3. Summary If you create a section macro with 2 columns in it with defined widths in pixels, if you don't include an extra line break inside the section macro it won't respect those defined widths h3. Environment (Optional - If Applicable) * Confluence Cloud h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page # Insert a section macro # Insert two column macros within the section macro, set their width as 100px # Make sure there is only one line break between the end of the column macro and the end of the section macro h3. Expected Results # Two columns of 100px each are created h3. Actual Results # Two columns that are 50% width are created h3. Notes Here is the bad storage format: {noformat} 100px

foo

100px

bar

 {noformat} Here's the good storage format: {noformat} 100px

foo

100px

bar

 

 

 {noformat} h3.Workaround Add an extra linebreak between the end of the last column macro and the end of the section macro. !workaround.png!
fields.summary: Section macro without an extra line break at the end will not render column widths properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37784].
  {panel}

Steps:

Error:

fields.summary: Admin can make set the default landing page is NOT dashboard, thus making another user cannot see the onboarding flow at the start

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37781].
  {panel}

As described per title, Spaces' icon/logo should be rendered alongside with the list of Spaces just like the dashboard.
• *Current Spaces List Macro*
!space-list.png!
• *Dashboard Spaces List*
!spaces.png!
fields.summary: Spaces List Macro Should Includes Spaces Icon/Logo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37780].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Currently Space Admins can be prevented from accessing the contents of a page, but they can use <base-url>/pages/listpermissionpages.action to reset the restrictions on a page in order to be able to view it. This can cause an issue if they don't remember what restrictions need to be put back on the page

h3. Solution
Add the ability to not just remove restrictions, but also modify them at <base-url>/pages/listpermissionpages.action
fields.summary: Allow Space Admins to modify page restrictions
Provide report of broken macros for Confluence administrators
Allow customization of the blueprint dialog's description content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37772]. {panel} h3. Summary: copy a page with linked attachment to another space will break the attachment link h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page, insert an attachement (attachment1.jpg) # Create a new page within the same space # Insert a link of the attachement by: #* Click Insert more content #* Files and Images #* Search on other pages > Search for the attachment >(write "attachment1 on the field) Search > Choose the image > Insert #* Save Page # Move this page to other space by: #* Tools #* Copy #* Set New Location to new space and parent page # Save h3. Expected Results Page copied normally with the attachment link still intact. h3. Actual Results The image link has broken. !Capture.PNG! h3. Workaround Copy to somewhere in same space then move to new location in new space: * Tools * Copy * Save to a temporary location within same space * Tools * Move * Set New Location to new space and new parent page h3. Notes Upon investigating, it seems like there is a difference of macro defined to link attachemnet *from the same space* and *from different space* Storage format of page containing attachment from the same space: {code}

{code} Storage format of page containing attachment from different space: {code}

{code} (note the "space-key") For more information please check the screencast attached
fields.summary: Copying page with linked attachment to another space will break the attachment link

fields.description:
|thumbnail![mailto:fabrizio3bianchi2@gmail.com
]
fields.summary: bianchi-fabrizio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37769].
  {panel}

h5. Summary:
Have a permission scheme to have user accounts that are:
# Able to log in
# Have a "Read-Only" account
# Not counted towards the license
# License scheme similar to JIRA Service Desk's Customer account

h5. Further Comments:

We are missing the option to run confluence in a 'semi' public mode. Fur is this would mean that the site itself is setup simular to the public configuration, but that we can have (unlimited) number of accounts that have read-only access.

We are putting up our documentation on a wiki based system which via sso is connected to our web-app. We would consider Confluence as the wiki, but the current licensing scheme would force us to buy over 2000 licenses, where as we only have about 5 editors. (And we are willing to pay a 'fee' to get additional read-only accounts)

A license scheme similar like the helpdesk would be really usefull for us. (Limited agents / editors, lot's of users that can create tickets)
fields.summary: Semi public permission scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37768].
  {panel}

How to reproduce to output WARN message.
# Install Confluence（64bit Linux Installer）to CentOS 6.5.
# Set 10,000.00 MB in Attachment Maximum Size of General Configuration 
# Create a space.
# Click "tool" - "Attachments", and upload a file from "Select files". (It doesn't matter how many size or what file's type)
#* Can't reproduce if the files are uploaded by drag & drop.
# Output the following WARN log. The file can be uploaded successfully.
{code}
2015-06-03 16:43:44,602 WARN [http-bio-8090-exec-1] [opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher] getMaxSize Unable to format 'webwork.multipart.maxSize' property setting. Defaulting to Integer.MAX_VALUE
 -- referer: http://192.168.56.104:8090/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=7733254 | url: /wiki/pages/doattachfile.action | userName: conf_admin
{code}



We assume that the WARN output if huge size is configured as Attachment Maximum Size and the file is uploaded from "Select files" of HTML form.
This WARN can't have any impact on Confluence, so it'd be better to remove WARN.
fields.summary: Remove WARN "getMaxSize Unable to format 'webwork.multipart.maxSize' property setting." when attaching files.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37735].
  {panel}

We just started using Confluence for ALL our company documentation, but we still use Zendesk for support ticket management. We are looking for the best way to sync content between Confluence and Zendesk Help Center articles.
It looks like Zapier would do this. JIRA is already available, but Confluence is sadly not an option. Zapier Support said it's definitely possible because you already have a 'very complete API available'. They also said you can add the app to Zapier yourself. Not sure what that involves, but since JIRA is already there, you've got one foot in the door!
Could you give me an idea of when this may be available? It would certainly rock our company socks!
Until then, keep up the good work! I've never seen a documentation program as solid as Confluence.
fields.summary: Integrate Zapier with Confluence

!expected.jpg!

!actual.jpg!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37713].
  {panel}

We use templates a lot and in most cases we use the Create From Template macro to allow users to easily create meeting notes, change requests, test reports, etc.

We are managing one big Confluence space for our project and we have different modules each of them with their own meeting notes, change requests, etc pages.

This pages are created using the Page property report macro filtering by label.

For example, all meeting notes have two labels: "meeting-notes" and "<module>-meeting-notes". Then we have a global page that shows all the pages with "meeting-notes" label and one page per module that list only "<module>-meeting-notes".

So, we would like to configure the Create from template button in each module page to add a particular label.

I'm adding a screen shot of a mokcup that may help better understand my request.
fields.summary: Create from template macro should allow to add labels to new page

Example:

Link in JIRA format (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/ABC-13456) will convert to JIRA macro when pasted on a  Confluence page.

Link in JIRA Service Desk format (https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/CA/queues/22/ABC-13456) will *NOT* convert into JIRA macro when pasted on a Confluence page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37696].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently Confluence allows to disable including the contents of a watched (and changed) page in the notification emails on a per-user basis (setting it for themselves): [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Email+Notifications].

Alternatively you can disable the function globally: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Globally+Disable+E-mail+Notifications+with+Page+Content].

In certain cases, such pages may have content that are not to be sent over e-mail, but watchers (may) still receive it.

h4. Proposal
Provide the option to disable sending the changed content of a page on a per-page or per-space basis.

h4. Workaround
It is possible to use a third-party plugin to protect the contents of a page: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.customware.confluence.plugin.vault].
fields.summary: Disable page content in notification per space/page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37692].
  {panel}

We have a Confluence instance where only the tool admin can set restrictions on pages, not users, because we want to keep the information open to anyone.
But when using the "File list" blueprint, the popup window allows the user to set restrictions on the page that will be created.

This breaks the space permissions setup, and furthermore the user cannot remove the restriction once the page is created (because then he does not have the rights to change it...).

There should be a control on the permissions in the blueprint.

This is quite minor, but leads to unecessary tickets to our support team to remove these restrictions.
fields.summary: Users can set restrictions in "File list" blueprint even if the space permissions does not allow restriction settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37690].
  {panel}

Hi,

Link : https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/PIG/UDFsUsingScriptingLanguages

In Confluence, under Pig UDFsUsingScriptingLanguages,
 under Subheading "Decorators and Schmas", 2nd Para, 

Typo Error :  '''outputSchemaFunction'''  wrongly typed as ''outputFunctionSchema'' 

Sample text:
'''outputFunctionSchema''' defines a script delegate function that defines schema for this function depending upon the input type. This is needed for functions that can accept generic types and perform generic operations on these types. A simple example is ''square'' which can accept multiple types

Thanks,
Sampath
fields.summary: Typo in Confluence site under Pig UDFsUsingScriptingLanguages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37689].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
As of now in Confluence, the default decorators are stored and loaded from {{<Confluence-Installation>/confluence/decorators}} folder in the installation directory. Should the admin apply their custom layouts by modifying the files on this folder and not from the {{http://<ServerBaseURL>/admin/listdecorators.action}} page on the admin UI page, Confluence will then take these custom changes and indicate it as a {{default}} layout instead. 

Documentation Reference: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Site+and+Space+Layouts#CustomisingSiteandSpaceLayouts-Advancedcustomisations

\\
h5. Suggested Solution
As a suggestion, it might be better if the default decorators files are not stored in the file system to ensure that the default layout decorators are not modified by the users.
fields.summary: Custom Layouts Modification in Confluence via Overriding Velocity Templates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37688].
  {panel}

On the following sentence from the Code Block Macro [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Code+Block+Macro], there's a dead link directing to http://www.undermyhat.org/blog/2009/09/list-of-brushes-syntaxhighligher/
bq. Language files must be correctly formatted JavaScript files and adhere to the [Custom Brush syntax|http://alexgorbatchev.com/SyntaxHighlighter/manual/brushes/custom.html]. You can find some examples of language files [here|http://www.undermyhat.org/blog/2009/09/list-of-brushes-syntaxhighligher/]. 

Can we please get this updated?

Thanks
fields.summary: Dead Link on Code Block Macro Documentation
Change Atlassian's mind.
Confluence should handle invalid gadget references gracefully

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37685].
  {panel}

It would be nice if confluence had a TODO markup, similar to a //TODO: in your code, indicating that some sort of work is needed upon revisit.

I.e. not "go buy groceries" but a todo as in "right here, on this line of documentation, in confluence, this image, what have you, come back later and fix this"

The point being, that some kind of macro would round up all descendants' todos, or some selectable tree (the whole space, whatever) and tabulate them nicely.

For now you can simply label pages that have known issues, mark them up in some noticeable way (red bold angly brackets?  funny green?).

When using confluence for internal documentation, etc. it's quite appropriate to have some ragged stuff, and appropriate to have completely visible "todo"/"fixme" items on there.  People using this public-facing may or may not see the benefit.
fields.summary: Todo markup.
Office Connector doesn't work in Google Chrome
